Posts.Content: I have just recently declined standard treatment to have a full aux clearance following a left side mastectomy and SNB and 1 of 3 coming up pisitive for a 6mm deposit. I had no idication pre surgery - my scans all show different things and i was asked back in for additional ultrasounds which took 20 mins and showed nothing other than one very slightly larger node. I was offered the POSNOC trial which is aiming to prove that further surgery is over treatment and you will find all the trial info on youtube in video .... after considering this trial i personally decided that i would opt-out of further surgey as long as my surgeon and oncologist agreed - which they both did - this extra surgery isnt performed in america and its unlikely it will be here in a few more years. I personally did not want to go onto a randomisation once id made my mind up. I am 42 with 3 young children and did not want to risk lymphodema - arm or shoulder weakness. I'd recommend looking at POSNOC - might help you consolidate your view - there is a lot of QandA on youtube.  good luck with your decision xxx
Posts.Title: Partial or total lymph node clearance?

Posts.Content: I have just recently declined standard treatment to have a full aux clearance following a left side mastectomy and SNB and 1 of 3 coming up pisitive for a 6mm deposit. Posts.Title: Partial or total lymph node clearance?

Posts.Content: I have my emend here infront of me - it says in the pack 1 hour before. (FEC2 yesterday) and the pharmasist also told me 1 hour.
Posts.Title: Daft question: anti-emetics

Posts.Content: Hey Lemongrass, i’m a day behind you. 1st FEC-T thursday 2nd. It’s hit me hard straightaway -within a few hours of getting home..headaches, terrible nausea despite the meds and fluey feeling. Sofa day yesterday and just up after a day in bed snoozing - can barely keep my eyes open - but need to head out with kids to watch fireworks and inhale some wintery air!!! Felt fairly flat for me today - but still feel strong mentally - and it looks like im on your yesterday- so should be brighter tomorrow - today ive just taken advantage of it being a saturday and my partner being amazing as ever nipping in tea and cold dtinks and trying to find things i’ll eat! Thats proving difficult!  I did cold cap - but im indifferent to the whole thing - the chemo nurses were judt so positive and telling me there is nothing to loose - give it a go - so i did - but im not prepared with wigs as i only found out chemo was coming on monday and so i’d better get going next week!!  One thing im finding bothersome is my mastectomy scar and skin on my chest is sore-supersensitive stingy?!  Not long now Anna - you’ll be fine - we are xxxx  Big hugs xxx
Posts.Title: First Session of FEC T

Posts.Content: Hi Angie - which clinical trials are you part of? Im on optima and did consider POSNOC. Optima (similar to ONCO DX) meant abit of delay and not knowing what was next - and i’d pinned my hopes on no chemo - so had to have a big talk to myself last week to get mentally ready!  Hugs xx
Posts.Title: First Session of FEC T

Posts.Content: hello girls, how are we all?  Good luck today Kim! You’ll be fine! I thought I was going to explode last thursday with nerves - the unknown in this context is bloody awful - but it really is OK and as with all this - whilst i’d rather not - it is doable! fingers crossed xxx  Anna K - did you have your first yesterday? Are you OK? Maybe keeping your head down? Hope you arent too sick and are coping - sending hugs xxx  Lemongrass - sorry havent responded sooner... struggled a bit to be honest with feeling awful and keeping up a cheerful face for my boys! My emotions have been allover the place! Not lije me at all! How are you fairing? I’m up and about now - out walking dog each day and ferrying boys around - plus sorting my house - nice to have the time - I’m not missing work one bit now I have handed my projects over... feel relieved!  Angie - think you begin soon too? You OK?  Happy Friday all xxxxxx
Posts.Title: First Session of FEC T

Posts.Content: Joanne....ask about optima trial .... its similar to oncotype dx testing but a more comprehensive test and no grey area middle ground ... worth seeing if you can participate - node positive is creteria inclusive
Posts.Title: Axillary Node Clearence

Posts.Content: Links would be great -yes please - my mum will be so chuffed if she can make them for me!  X
Posts.Title: Having a mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi all, I am due to have my left boob taken off on tuesday. It's all been so quick that im more than a bit nervous i must admit! I have been told that the combination of big lump and small boobs means that a lumpectomy would not be possible. I have known this for a few weeks now but have been waiting for tests to confirm node involvement etc and some baffling stuff around my lump (the one i found) dissapearing after biopsy (it was 2cm)... so asked if chemo first then surgery was an option - as id obviously convinced myself that i was miraculously healing/curing myself!!!! Medical professionalism dealt with my thoughts with a smile and quickly moved on to explain that because i have micro mets in the tested node and the vanishing lump was below the node this indicates this stage 3 Her + bulls**t is on the move. Im happy to have my boob removed - and will have sentinel node removal at the same time.  I'm really scared of having a op though! Never had one-no desire to be knocked out - i really am the ultimate control freak and this cancer business is pressing all the wrong buttons in that respect!! Lol!  Reconstruction has not been offered as an option atall for me - not until treatment has finished - i think that makes sense and i'm not sure i'll be up for it in the end as the way i feel about 1 operation is bad enough.  kacang - i fancied a knitted knocker too - im so small and skinny i just want something to fill the otherdidevof an already padded bra! Where did you get it?!  I am sooooo pleased i found this site - from the moment i posted about my worry about how long i'd have to wait after finding a lump to seeing the breast clinic (which incidently was originally booked for the day after im now due to have my surgery!) i was given such amazing advice - talked through what to expect at the clinic in such a sensitive and comprehensive way that i felt in control (did i mention that's important to me!!) and my anxiety was barely noticeable!  What im trying to say is a big thankyou - the admiration and respect i have for folk on here - the way posts and concerns are handled is awesome! Fab bunch in a shi*ty position ... but still fightling !!!!  Xxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Having a mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hey caz, how are you? I was thinking about your son's comments ... last night my small (6) chap wanted to take a bath with me - mainly, i suspect, to cop a look at his mums new look as he rarely washes voluntarily! Anyway his 2 pieces of wisdom were these:  Mum-id have got them both off - better balance!  The cut is long isnt it? so id have a think about a new one! (No idea??!!)  He is still adamant that no hair means no school run! Lol!
Posts.Title: Having a mastectomy

Posts.Content: Evening/morning.... ahhh yep not much sleep here either... there is a thread titled AWAKE.... in Breast Cancer that has folk on it most nights if you are struggling to sleep - you will find like minded insomniacs on there!
Posts.Title: cant sleep again

Posts.Content: Snap! i’ve gone back to wearing just a pre surgery padded bra now (surgery was sept so im comfy enough now) but still isnt right - so ive orderd some cheap as chips bra padding like for a wonder bra and if the create the right look im going to get them stitched into some bras. My breat nurse ordered me a few anomea’s but they are too big!
Posts.Title: Bras and prostheses for tiny boobs

Posts.Content: Good luck today Emma, its excruciating! A very surreal time! I was told that the lumps I had were likely to be fibroid(something) and biopsys were taken just to be sure - so when I went back last week to get my results I was so shocked to be given the news. I had been so sure it was cancer then talked myself out of it completely after my visit to the clinic. So what I'm saying is try to remain open minded and realistic - most lumps and bumps are not nasty but some are-it is an emotional rollercoaster and its so easy to get caught up in!! X
Posts.Title: New and nervous

Posts.Content: Badgerset....I love the father ted reference! I actually feel a bit like Dougal ... i have literally no idea what to think following my appointment yesterday ... it was like Ted explaining perspective to Dougal with the toy plastic cows .... near/far ..... breast off/chemo....  I 100% relate to feeling like it is happening to someone else .... i have just been to see the practice nurse at my surgery for an unrelated appt and she was asking me if i had a treatment plan... and i was like 'no not yet .... more tests next week' but thats not completely true - i do have more ultrasounds next week to clarify questions raised in MRI scan - but i also know that at a minimum the will be cutting my breast off in less than 2 weeks??!!   Such a crazy time-hard to get my brain to catch up... or maybe it's easier not to be in the moment?!  Lins x
Posts.Title: FEC it is then

Posts.Content: I too am pondering this and im thinking of posting in light if this being BC awareness month particularly as my cancer was not something obvious and i want to remind the girls i know that all sorts of changes need checking!  I have 3 young boys who have told school friends and judging by the amount of mums smiling and saying hi each day that never used to (increacing day by day) the word is well and truely out! Similarly i work for a large organisation and colleagues are getting in touch all the time! I was really reluctsnt for my news to spread far - but i have had little(no) control and actually the kind words in texts, cards, the flowers and gifts have been just brilliant at keeping my mood and head up!    Good luck and happy birthday!
Posts.Title: How to tell friends?

Posts.Content: Hey scaredgirl, yeah it's an absoloute nightmare isnt it? I'm sat at my laptop 'working from home' except i'm not .... im just staring at the screen! I was told i had BC on the 24th aug. I've had extra mammograms ultrasounds more biopsy's as they try to work out what my diagnodis is ... im told stage 3 with features of both lobular and ductal cancer ... the lump i went in with (the biopsy result as above) has gone? I spent tues looking at my before and after shots on MRI and mamogramme pics but whilst this was an unusual Perplexing situation for the consultants the other big mass was staring back at me!!!  It's crazy ... i'm 42 and have 3 young boys and an awsome partner .... im absoloutely not giving in to this bollox....and nor will you... its going to be tough - but completely do-able!! Xxxx
Posts.Title: Need some1 to talk please

Posts.Content: Yeah - mine is Grade 3 .... stage not confirmed - kerp getting so mixed up! I also had a node biopsy tues -but other breast confirmed as completely clear after ultrasound (MRI was showing something but all good) i'm due yo have a mastectomy this coming tues but am seeing surgeon tomorrow to pull all my results in - so i will know if hormone responsive etc..... Your daughter will be OK... at 15 she'll be much more able to understand how treatable this is ... my boys are either completely on board with my mantra (6 and 9yrs) or think im fobbing off the inevitable end..(11)  My 6 yr old has told me if i'm bald i cant ouck him up from school as it will be too wierd!!  ...  My cousins have declared my op 'tit-off tuesday' .... keep trying to laugh! X
Posts.Title: Need some1 to talk please

Posts.Content: Lesleyhelen-that is helpful thanks and to be quite honest i am getting this all mixed up - as lots have said before me-it's like a new language! But i really should get this bit right as it's the only bit i do know until tomorrow... i am grade 3.... stage still to be confirmed and my consultant said exactly as you describing the grade in relation to the abnormality of the cells. X
